intro: Soyauxia ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Soyauxia ledermannii plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly butterflies and bees.
